title: Ticket #4202: Add condor_history to Python bindings
description:
Here's the email from the user:

It would be great if the condor_history command were included in the python bindings. That way you could follow a job through to completion. At the moment you must either call the 'condor_history' command on the command line and interpret the text output, or just assume that if the schedd.query() function returns no job ads then the job has completed successfully.
remarks:
2014-Feb-19 08:09:21 by bbockelm:
Well, this is embarrassing...

Looks like I already implemented this as part of 8.1.2 when remotely-queryable history was added (#3897) to the schedd. However, the fact that there were python clients included seems to have missed the release notes.

Usage follows. 

history((object) requirements, (list) projection, (int) match) -> HistoryIterator :
        Request records from schedd's history
        :param requirements: Either a ExprTree or a string that can be parsed as an expression; requirements all returned jobs should match.
        :param projection: The attributes to return; an empty list signifies all attributes.
        :param match: Number of matches to return.
        :return: An iterator for the matching job ads

Brian

2014-Oct-09 10:01:44 by smoler:
Brian: please check the doc commit for correctness.

2014-Nov-05 10:08:43 by tim:
I reviewed the added documentation and it is correct.
